moves.2... f6: This is where the lesson begins. This is a o.k move for black. White will show the consequences of this move if black plays poorly.
moves.3. Nxe5: White took advantage of black's "f6". For those who do not know, the white knight can't be taken OR ELSE.  A good move for black now is Qe7 which will regain the pawn.
moves.3... fxe5: And the game is already over if white knows what to do. In this case, white knew.
moves.4. Qh5+: A very good move. g6 is horrible (Not the song) because it would lose the rook and a pawn after Qxe5+. Black's only "good" option is to move the king.
moves.7. Qf5+: Before the bloodbath would begin, black resigned. Remember that this was played in the casual section of the tournament. Once again, great play by white.

gameName: A lesson in the opening: 74th GK tournament quick win 2
